questionsData.title: Base is a substance that reacts with acids to produce salt.
The properties of water are unimportant for life on earth.
The light waves don't bend when passing from transparent medium to another.

Diseases spread by germs.
Sun eclipse happens when the moon passes between the sun and the earth.
"Nothing bad will happen' means "don't worry".
You'll find a mountain between two hills.
Chickens scratch with their beaks.
The diligent person is a lazy person.
"Miracle rescue "means "saving people in very hard situations".

To be ready to do anything is to be willing.
An applicant is someone who works in a school.
Greeting is used when you meet or write to someone.
Latin, Greek and French are names of countries.
questionsData.explain_answer: Latin, Greek and French are names of languages.

questionsData.title: Departure from is the opposite of arrival at.
Bow is the back part of the ship.
A monster is a lovely creature.
The text is mainly talking about ………..
questionsData.article: (Modern 1) medicine treats the body as if (it 3) were a machine made up of many separate parts that can break down. Treatment usually tries to repair the broken part with drugs or surgery. Doctors believe that the parts of the body must be treated as a whole. For example, to treat headache, these doctors might recommend massage to relax the body, get the blood flowing, and relieve the tension that causing the headache. The alternative forms of medicine, for example, the Chinese method of acupuncture which was considered an effective remedy for chronic pain. Some other forms of alternatives medicine like African herbalists have long history of using tree bark, roots, grasses, and flowers to treat diseases. Now around the world the scientists and researchers study the alternative forms of medicines. (Amazing 2) results have come from and it has been successful in treating headaches, muscles pain and even drug addiction. Nowadays, many people have lost faith in modern medicine because researchers have been unable to find cure for variety of problems from cancer to the common cold.

questionsData.title: I want ….. advice about my job.
One of the followings is NOT a compound word
The lecture was presented in a good way. The word "presented" is a/an…….
To change the word "register" into a noun, we add…..
My cousins keep on carrying heavier and …….bags.
Ali drives as …..as his father.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct answer is "quickly".

The sentence should read: "Ali drives as quickly as his father."
This is because "quickly" is an adverb describing how Ali drives, and the structure "as ... as" requires an adverb to match the manner of driving.

1. Adjectives (الصفات):

  • الصفات تُستخدم لوصف الأسماء (nouns). بعبارة أخرى، تخبرنا كيف يكون الشخص أو الشيء.
  • الإجابة على السؤال: "ما نوع أو حالة هذا الشيء أو الشخص؟"

أمثلة:

  • Ali is quick. (علي سريع) — هنا صفة quick تصف علي، وهو اسم.
  • This car is fast. (هذه السيارة سريعة) — هنا صفة fast تصف السيارة.

2. Adverbs (الظروف):

  • الظروف تُستخدم لوصف الأفعال (verbs) أو الصفات أو الظروف الأخرى. بعبارة أخرى، تخبرنا كيف يحدث الفعل.
  • الإجابة على السؤال: "كيف يحدث الشيء؟"

أمثلة:

  • Ali drives quickly. (علي يقود بسرعة) — هنا ظرف quickly يصف طريقة قيادة علي.
  • She runs fast. (هي تجري بسرعة) — هنا ظرف fast يصف فعل الجري.

متى تستخدم الـ adjective ومتى تستخدم الـ adverb؟

  • إذا كنت تصف اسمًا (شخص، شيء، مكان)، استخدم adjective.
  • إذا كنت تصف فعلًا (أي كيفية القيام بشيء ما)، استخدم adverb.

في السؤال الحالي:

  • "Ali drives as quickly as his father." — نحن نصف كيف يقود علي، أي نحتاج إلى استخدام adverb وليس adjective.

questionsData.title: Planes were…… by the government.
He has no idea …… to go after work.
My son failed in the Math's exam ……….he didn’t study hard.
When the telephone rang, I answered …….
The computers ….. fixed at the moment.
Are you…. in today's workshop?
How are you …..now?
After I had ……. at school, the bus came.
Poor people should be …….
questionsData.explain_answer:
Poor people should be Helped .

  • Helping: This is the present participle, indicating an ongoing action. While helping poor people is a continuous effort, the sentence talks about a general recommendation.
  • Help: This is the base verb form, which wouldn't create a complete sentence structure.
  • Helps: This is the third-person singular present tense, which wouldn't be appropriate here as the sentence talks about a general principle.
  • Helped: This is the past participle and the most suitable choice. It suggests a completed action or a state resulting from a past action. In this context, it implies that poor people deserve to be helped.

questionsData.title: He has …… many mistakes in his life.
questionsData.explain_answer:
He has done many mistakes in his life.

Present perfect tense .
